most_active_tickets.title: LTM-2.5 causes Chrome to freeze on large dynamic pages
Workstream activities tab is not working
Doesn't move past Initialising Desktop screen

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 12.0.0 Bugs Reported Across Platforms
common_issues.description: Users report various issues with Pieces OS 12.0.0, including Chrome freezing on large pages (Windows), application initialization failure (Linux), and Workstream activity sync problems (macOS).  The Chrome issue seems related to LTM 2.5 and large dynamic web pages. The Linux issue blocks application startup after the update. The macOS issue involves outdated Workstream activity data. Further investigation is needed for all reported issues.

related_issues.title: LTM-2.5 causes Chrome to freeze on large dynamic pages
related_issues.text:
LTM-2.5 causes Chrome to freeze on large dynamic pages
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When browsing webpages with large amounts of content and dynamic elements, Chrome freezes when Pieces OS with LTM 2.5 is active. 

[Culprit webpage (Clarity CRM API Docs)](https://claritymobileapi.claritycrm.com/Help/Document) is ~500 KB raw HTML, ~700 KB total page size. Dynamic element(s) are a scroll linked table of contents.

**What happens:**

* Chrome CPU usage spikes (~50% CPU) during scrolling.
* Memory usage stays stable.
* Chrome freezes for 10-15 seconds, unfreezes, and freezes again when scrolling resumes.
* Disabling LTM 2.5 resolves the freeze (Pieces OS still running).

**Expected:**
Pieces should handle large pages without freezing or jumping while scrolling.

---

### **Steps to Reproduce**

1. Enable LTM 2.5 in Pieces OS 
2. Load a large page (https://claritymobileapi.claritycrm.com/Help/Document).
3. Scroll through the page.
4. Observe Chrome freeze / become unresponsive as Pieces tries to capture context.
---

### **Environment**

* OS: Windows 11 Pro
* Chrome: 137.0.7151.104
* Pieces OS: 12.0.0
* LTM Version: 2.5
* Pieces Chrome Extension: Tested with and without--same result. 

---

### **Additional Notes**

I observed high-frequency DOM mutations via MutationObserver, but unsure if root cause (found 80-150 DOM mutations per scroll event)

related_issues.title: Doesn't move past Initialising Desktop screen
related_issues.text:
Doesn't move past Initialising Desktop screen
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi team,

Yesterday (15th June 2025), a new pieces version got released on snap. The new version broke the installation completely and the Desktop application doesn't move past the first step of initialization itself. I thought it was a problem with my system, but I tried a fresh install on a completely different device and same behaviour was observed. Please let me know if there is a way to revert back to the older version till the time this issue gets resolved. Also, please let me know if any further details are required to assist you with the resolution.

Distro: Ubuntu 24.04
Arch: x86_64

Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Workstream activities tab is not working
related_issues.text:
Workstream activities tab is not working
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I faced a sync problem, Can you check it please?

After the update, My activities wasn't updated.
It's 11pm but activities updated until 5am.
I used my computer for 0~5am and 7~11pm

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a22b6811-2841-4eb7-b214-36bf4528b702)

I think it can be same with #751

recommendations: Investigate and address the reported bugs related to Pieces OS 12.0.0 across Windows, Linux, and macOS platforms.
Prioritize resolving the Chrome freezing issue linked to LTM 2.5 and large dynamic web pages on Windows.
Fix the application initialization failure on Linux preventing users from starting the application after the update.
Resolve the Workstream activity sync problem on macOS to ensure accurate activity data is displayed.
Improve communication with users regarding the reported issues and provide updates on the progress of fixes.
Consider implementing automated testing to catch cross-platform compatibility issues before releasing updates.
Review and update the documentation for Pieces OS 12.0.0 to address any gaps or inaccuracies.
Monitor support channels for new issues and feedback related to the latest update.
Gather more data on the reported issues, including user environment details and steps to reproduce, to aid in debugging and resolution.
Allocate resources to address the most active tickets and prioritize based on severity and user impact.
Implement a system for tracking and categorizing support tickets to identify trends and common issues.
Analyze user feedback to identify areas for improvement in the software and support processes.
Provide training to support staff on troubleshooting and resolving common issues related to Pieces OS 12.0.0.
Develop a rollback plan for future updates in case critical issues arise.
Communicate the rollback plan to users to manage expectations and minimize disruption in case of a rollback.
Investigate the root cause of the DOM mutations observed on large web pages and optimize LTM 2.5 to minimize performance impact.
Explore alternative solutions for capturing context on large web pages without causing Chrome to freeze.
Test the fix for the Workstream activity sync issue thoroughly across different macOS versions and configurations.
Provide clear instructions to users on how to update to Pieces OS 12.0.0 and troubleshoot any issues they may encounter during the update process.
Consider implementing a beta testing program to identify potential issues before releasing updates to the general public.
Monitor the performance of Pieces OS 12.0.0 after the fixes are implemented to ensure stability and address any new issues that may arise.
Gather user feedback on the implemented fixes to assess their effectiveness and identify any remaining issues.
Continuously improve the update process to minimize disruptions and ensure a smooth experience for users.
